turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Felice Gimondi.
turn.1: What was Felice Gimondi's professional ranking?
turn.2: Felice Gimondi Felice Gimondi (; 29 September 1942 – 16 August 2019) was an Italian professional racing cyclist.
turn.3: Did he win any awards or trophies?
turn.4: With his 1968 victory at the Vuelta a España, only three years after becoming a professional cyclist, Gimondi, nicknamed "The Phoenix", was the second cyclist (after Jacques Anquetil) to win all three "Grand Tours" of road cycling: Tour de France (1965, his first year as a pro), Giro d'Italia (1967, 1969 and 1976), and Vuelta a España (1968).
turn.5: What else did you find interesting about his professional ranking?
turn.6: He is one of only seven cyclists to have done so.
turn.8: Gimondi was born on 29 September 1942 in Sedrina in the Province of Bergamo.
turn.10: He was the son of a transport manager and a post mistress.
turn.11: What did he do growing up?
turn.12: In his youth, he frequently took his mother's post bicycle and later helped with delivering mail on it.
